page.title: 17Pig Farming in Askham Bryan
page.content: The pig unit is at the west end of Askham Bryan College of Agriculture and Horticulture.There are 1030 sows and 6 boars.The pigs are housed in a long room,divided into small compartments.Some have straw bedding some don't.They get cleaned out about twice per month.The adult pigs get fed meal and water and the piglets get fed special pellets.They feed the pigs sometimes twice a day and sometimes once.They keep cross-breeds.They are used for bacon and they go to Bowers Bacon Factory in Malton.They are 5-6 months when they go and they weigh 85 kilos.They go to the factory on Thursdays.The sows have 2.4 litters a year and there are 10 in a litter.The temperature of the farrowing house is 60-75 f.
